answers.answer: I had one pregnancy where I swole so bad it hurt to walk.  I could gently rest my hand anywhere on my leg for a few seconds and i would have a huge impression of my hand.  It didn't matter if I stayed sitting, elevated my legs or walked.  Let me put it this way, after I delivered the doc put me on water pills...in a weeks time I lost over 20 lbs of JUST water weight.  I literally peed like every hour and would wake up numerous times a night to go.  I went from looking plump to looking sickly becuase I lost so much water weight.  So, no, you are NOT alone.  I ALWAYS swell with my pregnancies, but that one was the worst.  I even had to get different shoes becuase my feet were so freakin big.  Is this your first child?  The things I have read sound normal.  Unless you start having swelling in your face and hands and blurred vision there really is no reason to worry.

Yeah it probably is from extra blood volume and swelling...I never swelled with my daughter, even at the end...but with this one my feet have puffed up and my calves get red and swollen. I went to urgent care the other night for a migraine and my blood pressure was like 150/98..I was freaking out and the doctor was about to admit me for preeclampsia, but then I begged him to take it again because I have NO symptoms and he did and it was 110/62....so it was just a mis-read but I was so freaked out, lol.but GA is right of course, unless your hands and/or face swell and you get blurred vision it's most likely normal, albeit uncomfortable.

yeah it's very uncomfortable and its' really freaking me out..my inner thighs are so red, sometimes they almost look blue they're that dark.  The swelling is fine as long as i'm not on my feet for long but as soon as i get off work in the evenings it's horrible.  Blood pressure luckily has been fine so far, i'm paranoid and keep checking it though.  Someone else also mentioned it could be a blood clot that's making my innner thighs turn red but it's in both legs so i really doubt that. Anyway ladies thanks for the info. I'm really trying to relax and not worry but when it comes to the health of this baby and me of course (because i have another little girl depending on me)

question: I'm starting to feel like a hypocondriac (or however you spell it) I wrote earlier in the week about leg swelling.  Now i've noticed my legs are really red, dark red (inner thigh area).  I can leave fingerprints in my legs and especially in my thighs.  Has anyone else had this symtom or am i a loner again.  This is getting crazy..it seems like a new symptom pops up everyday which can't be normal but STILL my doctor isn't worried. Could this be from extra blood volume? UGH..any help would be greatly appreciated!!
title: ANOTHER worrysome symptom..this is getting crazy!!! Can anyone help or shed some light on this one!!
